titleStmt.title: A. B. Stephens et al. to Beriah Magoffin
CWG9944

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p:
Covington Ky January 23/61
To his Excellency Beriah Magoffin
Governor of Kentucky,

The undersigned would respectfully represent, that at the late term of the Kenton Circuit Court, Samuel Condell, was upon his own plea of Guilty, fined the sum of $5000 for Illegal voting, The facts are that Condell resided in the southern portion of the city, until a short time before the Election, when he removed to the Northern part, not however Crossing the Line of Magisterial District, when the Election came on he voted at the Northern precinct of the first Magisterial District, in total ignorance as we believe of the Law dividing said District -- we therefore respectfully your Excellency to remit the fine

A, B, Stephens
J, A Goodson
Wm Ernst
J. E. Spilman
John F Fisk
John Ellis

Kentucky Cir. Ct
Remitted
B. M
$50 } Illegal voting
Saml Condell
Issd Jany 30. 1861
The case of Mr Condell is like those of Wiggins and Ranson, already acted upon
